title: Earth: A Habitable Planet
desc: Overview of the physical processes governing environmental systems, from lithosphere to hydrosphere to atmosphere. Physical science perspectives on current debates, such as those over water resources, energy, and climate change. Natural Sciences Distro Area

title: The Health of the Biosphere
desc:
Dimensions of the ecological niche; growth and regulation of populations; interactions among populations; community structure and diversity; conservation. 
Prerequisite: CHEMÂ 152-0 or equivalent.
 Natural Sciences Distro Area

title: Humans and the Environment
desc: Introduction to human interactions with the environment. Topics may include but are not limited to energy, sustainability, pollution, and climate change. Natural Sciences Distro Area

title: Special Topics in Environmental Sciences
desc: Lecture course on environmental science topics of interest to students and faculty. May be repeated for credit with different topic.

title: Independent Study
desc:
Independent research on special problems under direct supervision of a faculty adviser. Comprehensive report required. 
Prerequisite: consent of program director.
